conversation.message: Hello School_A Admissions, I’m Student_E. I’m very interested in joining School_A and believe I would be a strong fit for your community. I would be excited to contribute academically and participate actively in school life. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C ranks me 4th (behind B, C, D). If I apply there now, I risk rejection if higher-priority students also apply. School_A is my 3rd choice but crucially ranks me 1st, so an early application should secure an immediate match and avoid ending up with a worse option. Given quotas are 1 each and competition is tight, locking in School_A is a strong strategic move.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your application and for your interest in School_A. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_A and would be excited to have you join our community.

We look forward to welcoming you.
conversation.thought: Student_E is #1 on School_A's true priority list and has applied in round 1. With quota 1, accepting now guarantees our top-choice match; there is no benefit to waiting for a higher-ranked student, and rejecting risks losing Student_E to another school (even though School_A is Student_E's #3 choice). Therefore accept immediately.

conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions Committee—I'm Student_B. I’m very interested in joining School_C and believe I’d be a strong fit for your academic environment. If offered a seat, I’m ready to commit and enroll. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, but School_A ranks me low (4th) and will likely accept Student_E or Student_D if they apply. School_C ranks me 1st, making it the safest way to secure a high-preference match early (it is my 3rd choice) before competition increases. Therefore I will apply to School_C immediately to lock in a strong outcome.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for your clear commitment to enroll if admitted. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_C.

Welcome to School_C—we look forward to having you join our community.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_B is the top-ranked student on School_C’s true priority list. They have submitted an [APPLY] and indicated willingness to commit. With quota 1 and no higher-priority candidate possible, accepting now secures the best feasible match and avoids the risk of losing Student_B to Schools A or B, which Student_B ranks above School_C.

conversation.message: Hello School_B Admissions, I’m Student_D and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m formally applying because I’m very motivated to enroll and contribute actively to the school community. If accepted, I will commit to attending. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B’s priority list ranks me 4th, early application is still my best chance, and waiting could let higher-priority students secure the only seat. I will express strong fit and commitment to increase the likelihood they hold/choose me if possible.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_B as your first choice. After reviewing applications received this round and applying our priority order, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your interest in School_B and wish you the very best in the matching process.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: School_B has quota 1 and priority order E > B > C > D > A. In this round, applicants are C, D, and A. Among them, Student_C is highest on our true priority list, so accepting D now would block a better match. Since E and B (even higher) may still apply later, the best strategy is to reject D and keep capacity for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions Committee, I’m Student_A and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly value the academic environment and would be fully committed to enrolling and contributing to the community if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Even though School_B ranks me last in its priority list, delaying would only reduce my chances further. A direct, sincere application is best; if rejected, I can move to School_C next round.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. After reviewing the applications received this round and applying our priority order, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We appreciate your interest in School_B and wish you the best in the remainder of the matching process.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: School_B has quota 1 and received APPLY from Students D, A, and C. My true priority is E > B > C > D > A, so among current applicants Student_C is highest. Student_A is last on my list, so accepting A now would block a better available candidate (C) and also risk missing even higher priorities (E or B) who may apply in later rounds. Therefore I should reject Student_A this round.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_C and I’m formally applying to School_B as my first choice. Your program is the best fit for my goals, and I would be excited to commit if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me 3rd (behind Student_E and Student_B), an early application gives me the best chance to secure the single seat if higher-priority students choose other schools first. Waiting risks losing School_B and having to settle for a lower true preference later.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. After reviewing the applications received this round and applying our priority order, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. If you remain committed to enrolling, we’re excited to welcome you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: We have quota 1. True priority list is E > B > C > D > A. In this round, applicants are D, A, and C. Among these, Student_C is highest on our priority list (rank 3), so accepting C dominates accepting D or A. Although Student_E and Student_B are ranked above C, neither has applied to us and both rank School_B as low/second; waiting risks ending unmatched or being forced to take a lower-ranked student later. Student_C ranks School_B as first choice and signals commitment, so accepting now secures the best available candidate this round and likely overall given incentives.

conversation.message:
Dear School_E Admissions Committee,

I’m Student_A, and I would like to formally apply to School_E. I’m excited by the opportunity to join a community where I can contribute academically and through extracurricular involvement, and I would take an offer from School_E very seriously.

Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_A
conversation.thought: Only School_D and School_E remain unmatched. On my true preference list, School_E (4th) is ranked above School_D (5th), so I should prioritize applying to School_E now. I also have top priority at School_E, which makes acceptance likely if they still have capacity. I’ll submit a clear commitment-focused application to secure the best remaining option.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and thoughtful note. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_E. We believe you would be a strong fit for our community, and we would be excited to have you join us.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_E, my true priority ranking is A > C > B > E > D. I have quota 1 and currently have applications from Student_A and Student_D. Student_A is my top choice overall, while Student_D is last on my list. There is no reason to delay: accepting Student_A immediately secures the best possible match for me and uses my only seat optimally. Student_A also has School_E as 4th choice, but they have applied, and an [ACCEPT] finalizes the match and removes risk of losing them to another school.

conversation.message:
Dear School_E Admissions,

I’m Student_D. School_E is one of my top remaining choices, and I’m submitting a formal application. I’m especially drawn to School_E’s community and would be excited to contribute through consistent effort in academics and school activities.

If offered admission, I will accept and enroll. Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_D
conversation.thought: From the remaining unmatched schools, School_E is higher on my true preference list than School_D (4th vs 5th). I should therefore apply to School_E now. Although School_E’s stated priority ranks me last, other higher-priority students may already be matched elsewhere, so a direct, committed application could still succeed. I will emphasize fit and commitment if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_E. After reviewing our current capacity, we are unable to extend an offer at this time because our incoming class is already full.

We appreciate your time and wish you the very best in the remainder of the admissions process.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: Student_D applied this round. However, School_E’s remaining quota is 0 because we already matched with Student_A (our top priority). Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any APPLY regardless of Student_D’s position on our priority list. Therefore, send a polite rejection noting the class is full.

conversation.message:
Dear School_D Admissions,

I’m Student_D, and I’m writing to submit a formal application to School_D. While my earlier applications did not work out, I have strong respect for School_D’s community and would be excited to contribute through consistent academic effort and active participation in school life.

If offered admission, I will accept and enroll.

Thank you for your consideration.
Sincerely,
Student_D
conversation.thought: Only School_D remains unmatched. School_D is on my true preference list (though ranked last), and I prefer matching to any listed school over being unmatched. Given its capacity is likely still open and School_D’s priority list ranks me #1, a direct application should be accepted if the seat is available. I will apply clearly and commit if admitted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for your clear commitment to enroll if admitted. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_D.

Welcome to School_D—we look forward to having you join our community.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_D is the top-ranked candidate on School_D’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and no current match. Accepting now secures our best possible outcome and avoids the risk of remaining unmatched or later receiving a lower-priority applicant. Student_D also states they will enroll if admitted, further reducing uncertainty.
